name: Washington State Employment Security Department
description: Provides unemployment benefits, and jobs and training resources.

name: WorkSource
description: Job training and assistance with job search.

name: Washington State Department of Licensing
description: Assistance reinstating driver's license.

name: The Northwest Justice Project
address: 401 Second Avenue S., Suite 407, Seattle, WA 98104
description: Legal aid program providing assistance to low-income people.

name: Northwest Immigrant Rights Project
description: Legal services focused on immigration issues.

name: Washington Law Help
description: Washington Law Help is a guide to free civil legal services for low-income persons and seniors in Washington.

name: Narcotics Anonymous
description: Chemical dependency support groups.

name: Alcoholics Anonymous
description: Alcohol dependency support groups.

name: Goodwill Industries
description: Open to all not just former felons; classes can be fairly competitive to get into.

name: Washington Connection
description: Website to navigate federal benefits and services throughout state.

name: Washington State Department of Social and Health Services
description: Referrals for social services throughout Washington state.

name: Division of Child Support
description: Can help women/men settle their child support bills

name: Oxford Houses Hotline - Benton County
description: Oxford House is a self-run and supported recovery house program for individuals recovering from alcoholism and drug addiction.  Oxford Houses assure an alcohol & drug-free living environment. You must apply directly at one of the Houses.

name: Choices and Changes, Inc.
description: Choices & Changes' ultimate goal for chemical substance abuse treatment is to empower the patient to achieve permanent abstinence, but the immediate goals are to enhance motivation to remain abstinent, improve the patient's ability to function, and minimize the health and community complications of chemical substance abuse.

name: Oxford House J. Harding
description: Oxford House J. Harding is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. Oxford House J. Harding is women and childerns facility.

name: Oxford House Park Hills
description: Oxford House Park Hills is a democratically run, self-supporting and drug free home. This is an all female house.

name: Oxford House Edison
description: Oxford House Edison is a democratically run, self-supporting and drug free home. This facility accepts men only.

name: Oxford House Kennewick
description: Oxford House Kennewick is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. This facility accepts men only.

name: Oxford House Vista
description: Oxford House Vista is a democratically run, self-supporting and drug free home. Oxford House Vista is an all men sober house.

name: Oxford House Olympic View
description: Oxford House Olympic View is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. Oxford House Olympic View is an all male facility.

name: Oxford House Keewaydin
description: Oxford House Keewaydin is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. Oxford House Keewaydin is an all male facility.

name: Oxford House Mahan
description: Oxford House Mahan is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. Oxford House Mahan is a women's self-supporting and drug free home.

name: Oxford House Cherrywood
description: Oxford House Cherrywood is a democratically run, self-supporting and drug free home. This house is open to women and children only.

name: Oxford House Davenport
description: Oxford House Davenport is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. This house is open to women and children only.

name: Benton-Franklin Community Action Committee
description: Offers a transitional housing program for homeless families, energy assistance, child care and minor home repair.

name: Chalen-Douglas Community Action Council
description: Providing assistance with home heating, energy conservation, housing, education, adult literacy and food distribution.

name: Hospitality House Ministries
address: 1450 S. Wenatchee Ave., Hospitality House Ministries
description: Hospitality House provides emergency shelter and transitional housing for homeless men.  We also provide free meals to residents and the public at 7am, 12pm, and 6pm every day.

name: Breaking Free Ministries
description: Anyone that is in need of housing and other vital resources

name: Central Park Place
description: Anyone that is in need of housing and other vital resourcesThis Low Income Housing (LIH) project has been in service since 1999 and has a total of 123 low income units, which is significantly more than other LIH properties. All of these units are set aside with rent lower than the rent/income ceiling. If you are interested in securing housing here, call Roy Johnson at (360) 993-9500.

name: Oxford House Franklin
description: Oxford House Franklin is a self-run, self-supported recovery house for recovering alcoholics and drug addicts. This facility accepts men only.
